Legal_Issue: Whether the RAD erred by refusing to consider all evidence, specifically the National Documentation Package (NDP)
Application_Facts: Applicants claimed refugee status based on gender and clan membership; credibility issues arose due to lack of evidence consideration
Decision_Outcome: Judicial review granted; case remanded to RAD for reconsideration
Remedy_Requested: Re-evaluation of refugee claim with full consideration of evidence
Court_Ruling: The RAD failed to consider the NDP, which contains critical country condition evidence, thus preventing a proper assessment
Defendant_Behavior: RAD did not consider all submitted evidence, particularly the NDP
Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard; independent assessment of all evidence required
Assessment_Factor: Country conditions in Somalia, citizenship law, credibility of applicants
Procedural_Issue: Failure to properly assess all evidence during appeal stage
Credibility_Assessment: Credibility concerns were raised but compounded by failure to assess key evidence
Legal_Provision_Cited: Sections related to refugee protection under IRPA
Application_Basis: Fear of persecution based on gender and clan affiliation
Evidence_Assessed: Some evidence considered (e.g., Somali citizenship law), but NDP omitted
Relief_Sought: Allowance of judicial review and referral back to RAD
Governing_Rule: The RAD must independently assess all evidence, including country condition documents
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to consider the NDP despite its relevance
Outcome: Judicial review allowed; decision set aside; matter referred back to RAD
Harm_Assessment: Risk of return to persecution based on gender and clan
Cause_Description: Applicants claimed refugee status based on gender and clan membership but were rejected due to credibility issues and lack of evidence consideration
Evidence_Handling: RAD failed to properly evaluate all relevant evidence, especially the NDP
Legal_Provision_Violated: Obligations under IRPA to conduct a thorough and independent review
Evidence_Issues: Omission of critical country condition evidence from assessment
Evidence_Assessment: Incomplete; key documents like the NDP were not reviewed
Decision_Rationale: RADâ€™s decision was unreasonable due to failure to consider mandatory evidence
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to consider the National Documentation Package (NDP)
